Professional Correspondence with Research [Originals & Photocopies]

Dates:
1970; 1972

Scope and Contents

4 Letters, 1 Archival Inventory, 1 Article & Notation

Addressed To: "John M. Clayton" ; "Margaret [W.] Rossiter" ; "Mr. Andrew Fiske, Sylvester Manor, Shelter Island, NY" ; "Professor Hall"

Sent From: "Andrew Fiske" ; "Margaret [W.] Rossiter, Harvard University, Charles Warren Center for Studies in American History, 53 Church Street, Cambridge, MA; 28 Lincoln Street / 420 Temple Street / 446 Humphrey Street, New Haven, CT" ; "Miss Horsford, Shelter Island," [Original Date July 29, 1864 from the James Hall Collection, New York State Library, Albany, NY]; "University Archivist John M. Clayton, Jr., The University Archives, Morris Library, University of Delaware, Newark, DE, Phone 302-738-2750"

In Reference To: Business / Family / Genealogy / History / Professional; "Preliminary Inventory of The Eben [Norton] Horsford Papers in the Archives, Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute" ; "Science in the Civil War: The Permanent Commission of the Navy Department" by Nathan Reingold from ISIS, Volume 49, Part 3, Number 157, September 1958

33 Pages, Bound & Unbound Typed, Printed & Handwritten in Ink & Pencil

Measurements: 6" x 9" - 8.5" x 10.25"

Margaret W. Rossiter (born July 1944) is an American educator and Marie Underhill Noll Professor of the History of Science at Cornell University. Rossiter coined the term "Matilda Effect" for the systematic repression and denial of the contribution of women scientists in research, whose work is often attributed to their male colleagues. Rossiter's works are available at New York University Libraries via Bobcat.

Florence Parker Simister is an American author. The Florence Parker Simister Papers are preserved in the de Grummond Children's Literature Collection at the University of Southern Mississippi in Hattiesburg, MS.

undated, circa 1989

Scope and Contents

1 Collection of Garden Image & Plan Reproductions, 1 Article, 1 Flyer

Article & Event Title: Garden Design excerpt "The Flowering of Central Park by (H.A.H.) Horticultural Alliance of the Hamptons member Jean Spiro Breskend" ; "Harry Marinsky F.I.A.L., Sculptures in Bronze and Watercolor Landscapes: An Exhibition and Benefit Sale for the Shelter Island Public Library Society"

In Reference To: Academic / Business / Family / Genealogy / History / Professional

40 Pages, Bound & Unbound

Printed & Handwritten in Ink & Pencil

Measurements: 8.5" x 11" - 22" x 16.5"

Fiske: Oversize

Scope and Contents

These materials are arranged in a loose chronological order. In the case that a record includes more than one date expression, the listing will begin with its earliest. If a record is physically undated, approximate ranges are provided. These records are noted "undated" and followed by a "circa" estimate determined by the range represented in the same series.

Record Group VI: Photographic Material

Scope and Contents

Record Group VI includes the collection's photographic material. These items largely document the Horsford family and the Sylvester Manor grounds. Photographic formats include cabinet cards and carte de visite, a variety of portrait prints of Horsford and Fiske family members, in addition to glass and film negatives, photo albums, scrapbooks, and tintypes.

Record Group VII: Artifacts

Scope and Contents

Record Group VII: Artifacts includes original housing containers in the form of document boxes, letter files, trunks, and wallets. These containers once provided storage for the documents and photographs previously described in this collection.

Metal Lockbox

Dates:
undated

Metal Lockbox

Dates:
undated

Scope and Contents

This metal lockbox includes letter satchels, small frames, a cigar box with ship records, and metal writing implements; the metal writing implements were originally housed with the materials from Box 107, Folder 25.

Assorted Containers

Dates:
undated

Scope and Contents

This assortment includes empty boxes, file folders, and letter wallets that once housed correspondence and photographic negatives.

Oversize Boards

Dates:
undated

Scope and Contents

These containers once housed engravings, large maps, and other oversize documents.
